filmography.title: Oklahoma!
filmography.role_description: A cheerful, confident cowboy in the Oklahoma territory who courts the farm girl Laurey against a backdrop of conflict between cattlemen and farmers.
filmography.plot: In the Oklahoma territory, a cowboy woos a farm girl while a menacing hired hand stands in his way, all set to the music of Rodgers and Hammerstein.

filmography.title: Carousel
filmography.role_description: A rugged, smooth-talking carnival barker who falls in love with a millworker but meets a tragic end, only to be given a second chance from the afterlife.
filmography.plot: A carnival barker is given a chance to return to Earth for one day to make things right with the wife and daughter he left behind.
filmography.awards: Laurel Awards: Win – Top Male Musical Performance

filmography.title: On Moonlight Bay
filmography.role_description: A handsome college student with unconventional ideas who begins a romance with the tomboyish girl next door.
filmography.plot: A tomboy's life is turned upside down when she falls for the boy next door in this nostalgic musical set in World War I-era Indiana.

filmography.title: By the Light of the Silvery Moon
filmography.role_description: Returning from WWI, Bill resumes his romance with Marjorie, navigating family chaos and misunderstandings as they head toward marriage.
filmography.plot: In this sequel to 'On Moonlight Bay', a returning soldier tries to settle down with his fiancée, but her family's antics keep getting in the way.

filmography.title: The West Point Story
filmography.role_description: A talented West Point cadet and nephew of a Broadway producer who is torn between his military duty and a potential career on the stage.
filmography.plot: A down-on-his-luck Broadway director goes to West Point to stage a cadet show and tries to lure a talented singing cadet into show business.

filmography.title: Tea for Two
filmography.role_description: A composer and pianist who falls in love with a wealthy socialite while trying to get financial backing for his Broadway show.
filmography.plot: A socialite bets her uncle that she can say 'no' to every question for 24 hours in order to win the money to back a Broadway musical.

filmography.title: The Desert Song
filmography.role_description: A mild-mannered anthropology student who secretly leads the Riff tribe as the masked hero 'El Khobar' to fight a corrupt sheik.
filmography.plot: A professor leads a double life as a masked freedom fighter in the Moroccan desert, battling a tyrant while wooing a general's daughter.

filmography.title: The Best Things in Life Are Free
filmography.role_description: The ambitious and driven lyricist and producer who forms one-third of the legendary songwriting team DeSylva, Brown, and Henderson.
filmography.plot: A musical biopic chronicling the rise, success, and temporary breakup of the famous songwriting team behind hits like 'Good News' and 'Birth of the Blues'.

filmography.title: Three Sailors and a Girl
filmography.role_description: A sailor who is entrusted with his shipmates' savings and accidentally invests it in a Broadway flop, which he then tries to save.
filmography.plot: Three sailors on leave in New York invest their ship's savings in a Broadway musical that turns out to be a disaster.

filmography.title: Look for the Silver Lining
filmography.role_description: The vaudeville performer who becomes the first husband of Broadway star Marilyn Miller and meets a tragic early death.
filmography.plot: A musical biography of Marilyn Miller, one of the brightest stars of the Broadway stage in the 1920s.

filmography.title: The Daughter of Rosie O'Grady
filmography.role_description: The famous real-life vaudeville impresario and theater owner who discovers the talented daughters of a protective Irish father.
filmography.plot: Set in the 1890s, three daughters of an Irish widower defy their father to pursue romance and careers on the variety stage.

filmography.title: About Face
filmography.role_description: A cadet at a Southern military academy who tries to keep his secret marriage and impending fatherhood hidden from the faculty.
filmography.plot: Three cadets at a military academy try to secure money and hide a secret marriage before the big graduation parade.

filmography.title: Starlift
filmography.role_description: MacRae appears as himself, participating in the 'Operation Starlift' effort to entertain troops bound for the Korean War.
filmography.plot: Hollywood stars perform at Travis Air Force Base to entertain the troops, while two airmen try to meet their favorite actresses.

filmography.title: Backfire
filmography.role_description: A recovering war veteran in a hospital who gets entangled in a murder mystery involving his missing friend.
filmography.plot: A veteran recovering from spinal surgery tries to solve the mystery of his missing friend who is suspected of murder.

filmography.title: Return of the Frontiersman
filmography.role_description: The son of a sheriff who is falsely accused of murder and must fight to clear his name in this rare dramatic western role.
filmography.plot: The sheriff's son is framed for a bank robbery and murder, forcing him to break out of jail to find the real killer.

filmography.title: The Big Punch
filmography.role_description: MacRae's film debut as a boxer who is framed for murder and flees to a small town where he is helped by a minister.
filmography.plot: A boxer is framed for murder and hides out in a small town, where he helps a minister turn the local youth away from crime.

filmography.title: The Pilot
filmography.role_description: A supporting dramatic role as a representative of the pilot's union dealing with an alcoholic aviator.
filmography.plot: An airline pilot struggles to hide his alcoholism from his employers and co-workers while flying commercial jets.

filmography.title: Zero to Sixty
filmography.role_description: A comedic supporting role as a police officer in this car-chase comedy.
filmography.plot: A divorced man hooks up with a street-smart teenage girl who makes her living repossessing cars.

filmography.title: The Gift of the Magi
filmography.role_description: The devoted husband who sells his most prized possession to buy a Christmas gift for his wife in this musical adaptation of O. Henry's story.
filmography.plot: A poor young couple struggle to buy each other special Christmas gifts in 1900s New York.
